group_1.textCenter: (There's no way this kind of Tracks of@Cherry Blossoms can be posted...)
(This sort of development was totally@outside my expectations...)

group_1.textRight: That's what I thought, but...

group_1.textLeft: You went and published the whole thing in@the latest issue of the Midori Report...

group_1.textRight: *Sigh*...

group_1.textLeft: This is called reaping what you sow... And@there's no excuse for your actions...

group_1.textRight: I'm the worst, I know.
But, you know...
When I decided to publish Sakurako's@"Tracks of Cherry Blossoms" in the end...
It made me feel like I'd done something@wrong.

group_1.textLeft: Then why did you even publish it?

group_1.textRight: For the sake of popularity and circulation.

group_1.textLeft: If that's what led to this self-loathing, then@there's really no saving you...

group_1.textRight: Well, that's the truth...
| ...What are you talking about? |

group_1.textLeft: She published the follow-up article on you,@and now she's beating herself up about it.
I sold your pure heart...

group_1.textRight: | But I don't mind. |

group_1.textLeft: If you say that, I'm already halfway saved.
Speaking of which, are you going to make the@cherry blossoms in Sankyo bloom after all?

group_1.textRight: | I can, but I've decided not to. |

group_1.textLeft: Well, that makes sense...after that sad@incident...

group_1.textRight: | When the cherry blossoms bloom, everyone@will disappear, so I won't let them. |

group_1.textLeft: Hmm?

group_1.textRight: She took it in a very strange way, Hinano.

group_1.textLeft: She had a lot of encounters and partings...
I suppose that's why she interpreted it that@way?

group_1.textRight: I wonder what she'll do when spring comes...
You don't suppose she'd try to cut down all@the sakura trees in the world, would she?

group_1.textLeft: Now that "cherry blossoms blooming = parting"@in her mind...
We'd better talk to Nemu before she does@something crazy.
Besides, we might as well give Yachiyo and the@others an explanation.

group_1.textRight: Yeah...[chara:304601:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:304601:cheek_0][chara:304601:face_mtn_ex_050.exp.json:motion_200][chara:304601:lipSynch_1]oh, maybe...?
Should we give them the Midori Report to@explain it?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, good idea!

group_1.textRight: What do you think?
This is probably the cause, isn't it?

group_1.textLeft: Most likely...
Now Sakurako's comment about not letting@the cherry blossoms bloom makes sense.
If the photos and descriptions in the article of@"Tracks of Cherry Blossom" are true...
Sakurako's been through a lot of new meetings@and partings over a short period of time.
It even made her associate cherry blossoms@blooming with separation.
She must have received too many shocks.
Just like an experiment where an animal is@conditioned to do something.

group_1.textRight: I knew it...

group_1.textLeft: Um, is there anything we can do to change@those feelings...?
To deny cherry blossoms blooming...
For Sakurako, that's the same as denying herself,@isn't it?
That's too sad...
If she tries to erase all the cherry blossoms in@the world, Sakurako will destroy herself...

group_1.textRight: For instance...
Do you think it's possible to make her form@a different association?
Spring is the season of change, when the@plants and animals come alive.
There will inevitably be many goodbyes. But...
There's more than one kind of change. Some@people will part, and some people will meet.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, that might be possible to convey to her.
I agree with you.

group_1.textRight: I see. If we show her that there will be good@things when the cherry blossoms bloom...
Sakurako's impression of it might change...

group_1.textLeft: In addition to that, we should show her how@there are different forms of parting.

group_1.textRight: Different forms... And Sakurako's experience@with goodbyes...
Ryo's Tracks of Cherry Blossoms might be@helpful for this.
I didn't expect to see the Midori Report play@such an active role...
I'm glad you found the article useful. My guilt@is all cured.

group_1.textLeft: No, you better reflect on what you've done.
